characters: TREMBLES AS THE BUILDING ACROSS THE STREET IS FLATTENED--
THE ABRAMS TURRET SPINS. THE CANON BOOMS. THE EARTH
OPEN MOUTH. HE'S BLOWN BACKWARDS, HITTING THE WALL AND--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun melts over squat residences on a narrow street. MARINE COMPANY creeps toward us like a cautious Goliath. FOOT SOLDIERS walk alongside Humvees and tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (radio chatter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie Bravo-3, we got eyes on you from the east. Clear to proceed, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun glints off a slab of corrugated steel. Beneath it-- CHRIS KYLE lays prone, dick in the dirt, eye to the glass of a .300 Win-Mag sniper rifle. He's Texas stock with a boyish grin, blondish goatee and vital blue eyes. Both those eyes are open as he tracks the scene below, sweating his ass off in the shade of steel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking hot box. GOAT (24, Arkansas Marine) lies beside him, woodsy and outspoken, watching dirt-devils swirl in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dirt over here tastes like dog shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you'd know. Goat balks and fixes his M4 on the rooftop door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK ACROSS bombed-out buildings, twisted metal and golden-domed mosques. Ragged curtains flutter out a window. Cat-tails on the river sway the same direction. We see him studying windage; we see what he's thinking-- SFX: A LOW FREQUENCY BUZZ escalates over picture as his concentration deepens. Cross-hairs land on-- A MAN ON CELL PHONE watches the convoy from a rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) I got a military-aged male, on a cell phone, watching the convoy. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think he's reporting troop movement you have a green-light. Your call. Over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He could be calling his old lady. MAN ON CELL studies the convoy, his hair tossed by wind. CROSS-HAIR push left of target, compensating for windage. SFX: Chris takes a deep inhale, holds it, then expels. His finger is taking up trigger-slack when the man dips his shoulder slightly. Chris holds off as-- MAN ON CELL hangs up and steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) He stepped off. Chris sucks air. Close. The ambient world floods back in. Barked orders, diesel engines and-- A WOMAN AND KID exit the same structure. They're headed up the sidewalk but cut sharply into the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) Hold up. I got a woman and a kid, 200 yards out, moving toward the convoy. (ECU)-- The woman cradles something beneath her robes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her arms aren't swinging. She's carrying something. CROSS-HAIRS ON WOMAN as she pulls a cylindrical object from her robes. His vision obscured but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just pulled a grenade. An RKG Russian grenade. I think she gave it to the kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you say a woman and kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SFX: his heart-beat, THUMP-THUMP THUMP-THUMP THUMP-THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got eyes on this? Can you confirm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. You know the ROEs. Your call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fry you if you're wrong. Send your ass to Leavenworth. THE KID moves toward the convoy with the grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck-- MOTHER motions the Kid to hurry along (ECU)-- her robes flutter, trash blows in the street, the dust off her son's footsteps; all blowing the same direction. THE KID sprints toward the Marines.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STREET
dialogues.text: YOUNG MARINES. Wading into war. Boots scuffing dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: His exhale hisses from tobacco-stained teeth. Breathe it down. He struggles to get calm, fighting for control.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS left of the running target, leading him, compensating for a dozen different considerations as-- He pauses upon exhale. The world goes quiet. Landscape pulses with color and focus. He stokes the trigger and--

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLET
dialogues.text: Leaps from the barrel. Cracks like a whip. The .300 round hurls forward, glinting as it enters the flesh of--

dialogues.speaker: A WHITE-TAIL BUCK
dialogues.text: It staggers, draws and topples to the ground. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A field shrouded in fog. CHRIS KYLE(8) jumps from a deer blind, innocent and excited, running toward the buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get back here. Chris stops, turns back. WAYNE KYLE, his father, is sturdy and earnest with mutton chops and Texas calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever leave your gun in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva shot, son. You got a gift. You're gonna make a fine hunter someday. Chris nods, clear-eyed, as if hearing the whisper of destiny. He grabs the .30-06, running again, bounding to-

dialogues.speaker: THE BUCK
dialogues.text: Glassy brown eyes look up at Chris. It's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything dies to give life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a deer, son. Chris processes his first kill, watching as-- (ECU) a flea crawls around the animal's inner-ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him hunting knife)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shot it, you deal with it. Chris straddles the deer. It tries to gouge him. He looks frightened but drags the blade across its neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Protestant church. CHRIS is dressed in Sunday best, shuffling pages of a LITTLE BLUE BIBLE to create breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't see with his eyes so we don't know the glory of his plan. Our lives unfold before us like puzzling reflections in a mirror. But on the day we rise, we will see with clarity and understand the mystery of his ways-- JEFF(6), his reedy little brother, watches Chris slip the Bible in his pocket. Jeff laughs and gets smacked by-- DEBBIE, their mother. She wears big oval glasses and runs a wayward-boys home with that same steady hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dust motes drift across a dresser, settling on a Pop- Warner football, that BLUE BIBLE, and METALLIC TOY SOLDIERS guarding the bullet casing from his first buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are three types of people in this world. Sheep, wolves and sheepdogs. PUSH THROUGH the modest ranch house into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAYNE lectures his boys over venison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people prefer to believe that evil doesn't exist in the world, and if it ever darkened their doorstep they wouldn't know how to protect themselves... those are the sheep. Jeff bites back tears. Chris looks troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM THE BACK, we watch a BIG BULLY pummel a KID ON THE GROUND. His meaty fists coming down repeatedly as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you got predators who use violence to prey on the weak. They're the wolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KID ON THE GROUND is JEFF, his nose bloody. PUSH TOWARD the fight--(ECU) blood flecks fly from the Bully's fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there are those blessed with the gift of aggression and an overpowering need to protect the flock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FIST CONNECTS with BIG BULLY's temple. He goes down. Chris stands over the bully, beating the tar out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These men are the rare breed that live to confront the wolf--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS stands with his arms extended. Wind blows dirt off his palms and it plumes out across the land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are the sheepdog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WAYNE removes his belt and lays it on the table. CHRIS looks at it, worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're not raising any sheep in this family and I will whoop your ass if you turn into a wolf--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wayne--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we take care of our own. And if someone picks a fight with you or bullies your brother, you have my permission to finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy was picking on Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eye swollen) Yes sir... Yes, he was...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to Chris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you finish it? Chris shows the swollen knuckles of his hand, and nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know who you are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROWN MAN(CHRIS) exits the barn into the light of day. Behind him, horns of dozens of bucks cover the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your purpose. The barn door closes leaving us in brindled darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hand grips the tie on a bronc. CHRIS sits bareback atop the horse, its nostrils steaming, eyes shock wide. (ECU)- a hair-line crack along its right front hoof. BUZZER SOUNDS. GATE OPENS. The bronco leaps out. Empty stands blur past. The Bronc and Chris united in a futile struggle. He leans right, the bronc circles right, staying off that bad hoof. Chris makes the buzzer but-- He gets tossed on dismount. The bronco stomps his hand. He scrambles out of the ring as RODEO CLOWNS distract it. FIND JEFF(19) ringside, with tight lips and severe eyes. He looks over the empty arena, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Headlights rattle over a dirt road. JEFF drives. CHRIS rides, BAG OF ICE on hand, BELT BUCKLE prize on the dash. He stares into the field where A WILD HORSE, races alongside them, a spectral image in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't nobody there and you come away with a belt buckle too damn big to wear. What you supposed to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabs belt buckle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're supposed to get laid with it. I'm gonna wear it in and see if it puts Sarah in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strong wind'd put Sarah in the mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what they called her in high school--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sarah suck-a-- Chris swings his bag of ice, smacks Jeff in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit man-- He swerves off the road. The truck almost coming apart before he ramps back up, coming to a dusty halt outside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spanish moss hangs over a shackle-board residence. Chris tumbles out the truck, clips on the belt buckle and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS swaggers into the narrow bunkhouse. A sheet hangs in back, separating sleeping area from living area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to hump a rodeo star? Movement back there. A MAN ASS suddenly protrudes from the curtain as a BURLY COWBOY-TYPE climbs into jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck-- SARAH steps out, his high school sweetheart all grown up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you wasn't coming home until tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wounded)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would you do this? Cowboy leaves his shirt open flaunting a big hairy chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just let him out. He didn't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shamed, steps aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't know? Cowboy doesn't answer. Chris SLAMS HIS HEAD into the refrigerator and ramps him out the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you! What'd you expect? You drag me out here then run off with your damn brother every weekend!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out. She jumps at the chance-- ripping clothes out of closets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're a cowboy cause you rodeo? You're no cowboy. You're just a lousy ranch-hand and a shitty fuckin lay! The door slams behind her. Chris stares at the dent in the fridge, wounded. He opens it and pulls out a beer.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: TV plays across Chris' drunken face. He lays on the sofa, a beer on his chest. JEFF is sprawled in a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people ain't worth fighting for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A job is a job. At least we're outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris is bleary, lost and drifting to sleep. The images on the TV don't immediately register but-- NEWS FOOTAGE of the WORLD TRADE CENTER BOMBING (1993) plays on TV. An explosion has demolished the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --group of radical militants called Al- Qaeda are taking credit for a bombing that left six dead and hundreds injured-- American flags at half mast. His chest rises and falls--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff, wake up. Look at this-- The faces of INNOCENT VICTIMS play across the screen. Chris' injured hand slowly curls into a fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what they did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters of destroyers on walls. The NAVY RECRUITER is lean and shrewd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw what they did, on our soil, and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're from Texas and you're a patriot so it pissed you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. But I can't see myself on a ship. I'd wanna be in the fight--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna fight? Meet the warrior elite. He slides him a brochure-- "NAVY SEALS" emerge from the water, armed and bound for glory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEALs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sea, Air and Land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't much of a swimmer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking brochure back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't for the faint of heart. Most men wash-out. They quit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting him off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not most men, sir. I don't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and 50 OTHER CANDIDATES lay on their backs doing flutter-kicks on a patch of blacktop surrounded by beige buildings. INSTRUCTORS wield hoses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sprays Chris in the face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a quitter, boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you are fleet-meat. Don't turn away. Look up and take it. You're old as fuck. Did you join the Navy cause you had such a good time on Noah's Arc? How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 30! You fart dust and could've fathered half these boys. You think cause you had a pop-gun back in Texas you're cut out to be a SEAL?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not cut out to be one? Chris is twisted in agony and clearly dislikes the water. (03.18.14)                         12. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of asshole joins the Navy but hates the water. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love water, hooyah. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ass you do. A CANDIDATE chokes a giggle. Rolle wheels around on-- RYAN JOB(24), a goofy, overweight Oregon kid who looks like he should be taking orders at a drive-thru window. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you giggling you fat fuck? Look at you. You're so fat they had to baptize you at Sea World. Your momma fat too? RYAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No sir, she's not. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't lie to me! I bet we could use her panties as a parachute. What the fuck are you doing here fatboy? Do your feet get wet when you shower? When's the last time you saw your pecker? You're not a Seal, you're a fuckin Walrus. A big giggling Walrus. "Biggles" that's your new name-- "BIGGLES" is choking, coughing, struggling. ROLLE points to A BRASS BELL mounted on the back of a truck. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and that's your ticket home. Just drag your jelly-roll ass up and ring it and you'll be headed home to momma Shamu. BIGGLES is beaten, legs giving out, ready to quit when-- CHRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (draws Rolle off Biggles) Two hundred. INSTRUCTOR ROLLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whirls around, hosing) Did I ask you to count? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that your ass talking then? THE BELL RINGS. Chris jerks up, worried it was Biggles but-- an ATHLETIC CANDIDATE staggers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a quitter. If he quits here, he'll quit in battle. When shit gets hairy he can't step up. You get shot, he can't pull you out. We're gonna weed out the quitters and see if we can find a warrior or two. Chris and Biggles share a look, a vow, as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wave goodbye to the sun, boys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bonfire crackles atop a sand dune. CANDIDATES crouch in a pit they dug, hugging oars, shivering with hypothermia. CHRIS stands over the ditch, trying to make INSTRUCTORS laugh to earn a place by the fire beside BIGGLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --and when I told her the condom broke she started crying and begging me to do something. And I'm a virgin, I don't know what to do, but I'd heard if you pour Coke up there you won't get pregnant-- (guys start laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we went to 7-11, got a liter of Coke and drove back into the woods. She took her panties off and did a handstand against a tree but when I start pouring, she starts screaming, "it stings, it stings" but when I'd stop, she'd scream "no don't stop" and it's fizzing out and-- INSTRUCTORS in stitches. Fire flickering off Chris' face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog shrouds CANDIDATES COVERED IN MUD, seated belly-to- back, chattering and quaking, hypothermic. "INSTRUCTOR TONY"(34), a salty cholo, walks their line. (03.18.14)                          14. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really from Connecticut, Dauber? I never met a hick from Hartford. "DAUBER" is 6'4" and 240 with a flop of yellow hair like the character from Coach. A sleepy Connecticut cowboy. DAUBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Country is countrywide, sir. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think he likes black dudes, "D". "D" is African American, from Indiana, stoic and stacked. He has a rhythmic grumble and a meat-eater's glare. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's alright, sir. I'm not black. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm new black. We run slow, jump low, swim good and shop at Gap. We make white folk proud then hose their ladies. "BIGGLES" still giggles, but he's looking fit as they chip away everything that isn't a Navy Seal. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry Biggles? I'd bet you'd eat the ass out of a low-flying duck. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooyah. I'd toss that critter shitter on a baguette and get my eat on. "SQUIRREL" is a San Clemente surfer kid, just tall enough to ride roller-coaster, with a jutty jaw. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams in his face) Squirrel! Where'd you hide your nuts? SQUIRREL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nuts crawled up inside. The little shits are gone for good. "CHRIS" sits up front, covered in mud. His eyes burn steely blue, full of resolve. He's found himself here. INSTRUCTOR "TONY"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you old man? How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dangerous, sir. Feeling dangerous. The boys send up a spirited "HOOYAH" and-- TONY looks them over with some small measure of approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The INSTRUCTOR CADRE watches 32 CANDIDATES SWARM each other, howling and dog-piling at the end of hell-week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowd watches the boys toss darts at a bulls-eye drawn on DAUBER'S naked back. At the bar, BIGGLES and CHRIS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna try and get into sniper school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you shoot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can hunt. And what's cooler than being a sniper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blowing shit up. Blowing shit up is way cooler. A brunette steps to the bar. A sharp object with heavy eye-shadow and tight leather pants. This girl owns her sexuality but she's often been used for it. This is "TAYA". She is trying to ignore the advances of A SHORT NAVY GUY but he's relentless. Chris watches as (ECU)-- Taya's fingertips whiten, gripping her glass. Chris edges closer, she looks up, defensive-- but he just stands there, letting his protective presence be felt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, just let me buy you a drink. (03.18.14)                          16. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (end of her rope) Will a drink make you 6 inches taller and charming? Will it make you not married? DAPPER NAVY GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I watched you take your ring off. Don't be a scumbag. Go home. Navy Guy retreats. Taya sips her scotch, doesn't look up. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be the leather pants. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What kind of pants does a girl have to wear to be left alone? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corduroy. She takes him in. Loose sweatshirt, no hair gel. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that how it is with you guys-- suddenly single after three beers? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only thing that happens to me after three beers is a fourth. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. A real red-neck. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no redneck, I'm a Texan. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the difference? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ride horses, they ride their cousins. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost laughs) What do you do for work? You look like military. (03.18.14)                     17. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I polish dolphins. They have to be polished in captivity or their skin disintegrates. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look stupid to you? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be honest, you look a little sad. She's taken aback by his observation. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I tall enough to buy you a drink? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until you tell me what you do. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about this: one shot, one answer. Chris passes her a shot. She throws it back, fierce. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're obviously military. What branch? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just finishing BUD/S. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me? You're a SEAL? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was two questions... TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (two angry shots) I know all about you guys. My sister was engaged to a SEAL. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean you know all about us? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a bunch of arrogant, self-centered pricks who think you can lie and do whatever the fuck you want. (pushes him a shot) I'd never date a SEAL. (03.18.14)                   18. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) How can you say we're self-centered? I'd lay down my life for my country. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause it's the greatest country on earth and I believe it's worth protecting. (climbs off stool) I'm sorry this guy hurt your sister but that's not me. Nice talking to you. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you'd never date a SEAL, so I'm going home. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd never marry one. It's a lie and they both know it. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well in that case... what's your name? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Taya. I'm Chris Kyle. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (liquor softening her) Pretty egotistical of you to think you can protect us all, isn't it Chris? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our instructors say our biggest enemies are ego, liquor, and women. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you're under attack. She levels a look and downs another shot--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mist rolls in. Chris holds Taya's hair as she pukes. She takes a deep breath, wipes her mouth--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm not going home with you so don't even think about it. She smiles, then turns to puke again--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An arid range with human-shaped targets. PETTY OFFICER TOSH (Irish/Japanese, nasty) walks past prone students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel breath filling every cell of your body. This is our ritual. We master our breath, we master our mind--- FIND CHRIS on .300 Win-Mag. Both eyes open. Dip packed. Deep breaths. His finger taking up the trigger-slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --pulling the trigger will become an unconscious effort. You will be aware of it but not directing it. And as you exhale, find your natural respiratory pause and the space between heart-beats. Chris exhales, pauses, strokes-- BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ZOLOFT BROCHURE shows smiling faces. TAYA wears a suit- skirt and tries to mimic the esprit of the brochure. She leaves a box of samples with the RECEPTIONIST but her smile fades as she pulls her trolley to the door--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blades of light leak through closed blinds. Taya hides under blankets on the sofa. PHONE RINGS, goes to message:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me again. The guy whose shoes you puked on? I was thinking maybe you didn't get my last message. Or the one before that. So, I figured--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She snatches up the phone--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You figured what? --looking for a reason not to be alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON CHRIS, both eyes open looking downrange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim small, miss small. If you aim for his shirt button, you might miss by two inches. If you aim for his shirt, you miss by two feet. (over Chris, raises binocs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better close those groupings, Kyle. Chris chases his breath, trying to focus, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS a "target shoot" game to a bench overlooking surf. CHRIS and TAYA sit with a GIANT TEDDY BEAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you always want to be a soldier?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to be a cowboy-- but I did that and I felt like I was meant for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you started rescuing girls from bars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I rescued that bar from you. She smiles at his sweetness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like country music?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only when I'm depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday. My mom says I have a nose for picking the wrong men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a shitty thing to tell a girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've proven her right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But those wrong picks put you here. They made you who you are. And I like who you are. The Ferris wheel casts its glow on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens when there's a real person on the other end of that gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (uncertain)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... I just pray I can do my job if that day comes. It weighs on him. And she feels safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PO TOSH (on spotting scope) stands over CHRIS. Mirage boils off the horizon at 35 degree angle, pushed by wind. BAM! Chris' shot hits the outer edge of target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mirage is boiling at 35 degree angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check. I'm dialed for windage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold right-four, up-two. BAM! He misses. It spits dirt. Not even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we looking at the same target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS sits on the couch, anxious, until TAYA appears in the hall in lingerie. She slinks closer, straddling him, determined to blow his mind but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trembling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I don't... She finds his eyes. Finds her breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to do this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to. I do... He gently lifts her up and lays her across the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soft light on pale bodies. Taya writhes with impatient longing but Chris' steady hand forces her into the present. She's swept up, eyes filling with tears as he eases into her-- she gasps and arcs and draws him deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PO TOSH stands over CHRIS, fed up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to shut your off-eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I close my off-eye I can't see what's out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is nothing out there but a target.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. There's something--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circular scope floats over the target. Left of scope, a SWATCH OF GRASS doesn't sway like the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me 50 push-ups. Clear and safe. Push `em out. The scope drifts left of target-- BAM! A RATTLESNAKE is flung through the air, blown to shit, 500 yards out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There it is. He sets the rifle aside and starts cranking out push-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ethereal white sheets. Two bodies lay like spoons. Chris WHISPERS SOMETHING. Taya closes her eyes. A beat--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hardly even know me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know enough. You're a package deal, babe. She stares at the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Everything. I don't know. What if it doesn't work out? She moves to stand. He holds her put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to marry you, and we're going to start a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it all planned out, don't you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crushed by his sincerity)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... you're gonna need a ring if you want to talk all tough like that. She accepts with a deep kiss and prances off with the sheet. He smiles and falls back onto the bed. The curtains dance in the morning light. Then--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! No! Chris-- Chris bounds up, running into the next room. Taya stands in front of the television. They both watch as-- ON TV NEWS: THE SECOND PLANE hits the World Trade Center. It steals their breath. Chris hugs her close, trying to shield her from it. His shock bleeds to rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The storm closing in. CHRIS two-steps TAYA around the dance floor to Van Morrison's romantic "Someone Like You." Chris looks boyish and dapper and Taya is flush with beauty and promise. The moment is quietly sincere with the entire WEDDING PARTY watching when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her hand smudged with paint)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is on your neck? She pulls at his collar to reveal GREEN SPRAY-PAINT upside his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you believe me if I told you I was painted green and on an IV two hours ago?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you-- Then she sees BIGGLES, DAUBER, "D" and SQUIRREL rolling with laughter at the bar, and remembers who she married. CHRIS (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Package deal babe. He dances her away from them and pulls his jacket aside, flashing his boys the Trident pinned to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BAR
dialogues.text: TONY bowls up; once their instructor, now their Chief. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the word, Chief? TONY (looks them over)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on boys. Just got the call. They hoist their drinks, barking approval, "HOOYAH!"

dialogues.speaker: ON DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Taya sees the nod from Biggles to Chris, we're going. She tenses up in his arms, her feet growing heavy. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say it'll be over in 6 weeks. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so afraid. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. It's all part of the plan. He pulls her close, HIS EYES FIXED on someone else-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart is beating out of your chest. CHRIS (nods, looking past her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the only one going to war. JEFF KYLE stands on the rail in MARINE DRESS UNIFORM.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: The boat rocks on choppy water. Taya dabs cake on Chris's nose and they kiss. THE BOOM of distant fireworks is followed by AIR-RAID SIRENS as shock & awe hit Baghda

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHYRON: "OPERATION PHANTOM FURY: 2nd BATTLE OF FALLUJAH"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to Fallujah. The new wild west of the old middle east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS sit elbow to elbow. 6 SEAL SNIPERS and A SQUAD OF MARINES to watch their backs. CHRIS tucks the little blue Bible and American flag and into his webbing then removes his wedding band, hanging it from his necklace. MARC LEE AO2 (26) is a poster-boy Navy Seal, soulful and handsome. He glows like a halo in a river full of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AQI have put a price on your heads and extremists from around the globe are flooding the borders to collect on it. The rig hits a pothole and faces clench expecting an IED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You snipers will be paired with a man to watch your back and inserted along the main road to do "overwatch" for 1st Marines going door to door. Your job is to protect those Marines at all costs. The truck battles to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The city was evacuated. Any military-aged male still here, is here to kill you. Let's bring these boys in safe and get our asses back home. Move-- The hatch falls open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gunmetal sky. The staccato pop of GUNFIRE in the distance. SNIPERS and SUPPORT cross an orchard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS walks upright. The Marine paired with Chris is a mouthy Arkansas boy, "WINSTON", skitters tree to tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your head down, Tex. The Muj' got snipers too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sniper won't aim for your head. A DOZEN MARINES are posted outside an apartment complex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got this sniper that's been hitting headshots from 500 yards out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An open atrium eight stories tall. CHRIS and WINSTON walk past a giant pile of furniture and debris tossed down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --they call him "Mustafa." He was in the Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got sniping in the Olympics now? They start up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris walks from APARTMENT TO APARTMENT, some vandalized, others untouched, checking sight-lines out windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trailing Chris)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever hunt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't that kind of red-neck. He unzips and peels off into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, fuck-- WINSTON FIRES TWO ROUNDS in the bathroom. Chris pulls a Springfield .45 as--

dialogues.speaker: A GOAT
dialogues.text: Bounds out of the bathroom, runs out the apartment door and leaps OVER THE RAILING, falling six floors.

dialogues.speaker: RAILING
dialogues.text: CHRIS and WINSTON look down to the lobby, where Marines stand around the DEAD GOAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just got your first kill, Goat. "GOAT" (not Winston) will be his name from here out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to the roof. You stay here and be on the lookout for farm animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a corrugated piece of steel, a ritual unfolds-- Chris packs a dip. He lays out his Bible and flag. Loads bullets in a wrist-sheath. Starts to marshal his breath. Time slows as he lowers his eye to the glass. (NOTE: we are back to the beginning of the film.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACK ACROSS bombed-out buildings, twisted metal and golden-domed mosques. Ragged curtains flutter out a window. Cat-tails on the river sway the same direction. SFX: A LOW FREQUENCY BUZZ escalates over picture as his concentration deepens. Cross-hairs land on-- A MAN ON CELL PHONE watches the convoy from a rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a military-aged male, on a cell phone, watching the convoy. Over. (03.18.14)                          29. COMMANDING OFFICER (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he's reporting troop movement you have a green-light. Your call. Over. MAN ON CELL studies the convoy, his hair tossed by wind. CROSS-HAIR push left of target, compensating for windage. SFX: Chris takes a deep inhale, holds it, then expels. His finger is taking up trigger-slack when MAN ON CELL dips his shoulder, hangs up and steps away. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) He stepped off. Chris sucks air. Close. The ambient world floods back in. Barked orders, diesel engines and-- A WOMAN AND KID exit the same structure. They're headed up the sidewalk but cut sharply into the street. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. I got a woman and a kid, moving toward the convoy. (ECU)-- The woman cradles something beneath her robes. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her arms aren't swinging. She's carrying something. CROSS-HAIRS ON WOMAN as she pulls a cylindrical object. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just pulled a grenade. An RKG Russian grenade. I think she gave it to the kid. COMMANDING OFFICER (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you say a woman and kid? SFX: his heart-beat, THUMP-THUMP THUMP-THUMP THUMP-THUMP. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got eyes on this? Can you confirm? Over. COMMANDING OFFICER (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. You know the ROEs. Your call. GOAT (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fry you if you're wrong. Send your ass to Leavenworth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE KID moves toward the convoy with the grenade. CHRIS KYLE (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck-- MOTHER motions him to hurry along (ECU)-- her robes flutter, trash blows in the street, the dust off her son's footsteps; all blowing the same direction. THE KID sprints toward the Marines.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STREET
dialogues.text: YOUNG MARINES. Wading into war. Boots scuffing dirt.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: His eyes water with focus, his exhale hisses from tobacco stained teeth. Breathe it down. He struggles to get calm.

dialogues.speaker: SFX
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS left of the running target, leading him, compensating for a dozen different considerations as-- He pauses upon exhale. The world goes quiet. Landscape pulses with color and focus. He stokes the trigger and--

dialogues.speaker: THE BULLET
dialogues.text: Leaps from the barrel. Cracks like a whip. The .300 round hurls forward, glinting as it enters the flesh of--

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: He winces, sickened, and struggling to swallow the little piece of him that just died. GOAT (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Fuck that was gnarly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOTHER flees down sidewalk, robes aflutter. CROSS-HAIRS lead her. BAM. It pocks wall behind her. A round ejects. CROSS-HAIRS swing forward, leads her more. BAM. She runs into scope, reaches center, meets bullet. A red mist. GOAT (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit yeah. Evil bitch! COMMANDING OFFICER (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice shooting, Tex. Helluva call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that. Good lookin' out Navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that? He nudges Chris, trying to get a celebration out of him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck off me. This is the reality of war. Not like he anticipated.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Breath racing. Bleeding sweat. Trying to process his disgust. Trying to inject some purpose, mumbling: Protect the Marines. Protect the Marines. Protect... Clouds crawl over Chris like ghosts, swirling feverishly as HOURS SLIDE BY. His face takes on a preternatural blankness as he begins to slip into the shadows of self. Suddenly-- clouds halt, pupils flare, chest inflates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun flares as MARC LEE advances alongside 1ST PLATOON MARINES (40 men) when-- A SHOT SOUNDS. A BODY TUMBLES out of the sky and lands in their midst with a meaty thud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Fuck, man! What the hell-- The Marines duck for cover then look to the sky--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Where'd it come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your overwatch, Einstein. You can thank him later. Keep moving. Marines slowly return to standing, glancing up at surrounding structures trying to spot their protector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris lays atop a baby crib. A scrim hangs in front of him. Sunlight burns through it, casting a thousand pinpricks of light across his face. SUN MARCHES ACROSS the sky and pixels twist over his cataleptic shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly-- sun halts, chest inflates, eyes flare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR SPEEDS toward 1ST PLATOON. MARINES open fire with the feeble POP-POP of M4s. The car still coming-- A SNIPER SHOT BOOMS across the sky like thunder. The windshield spiders, blood splattered, and the car stops. As Marines search rooftops for him-- THE CAR EXPLODES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS plants a loop-hole charge at the base of the wall and steps around the corner to trigger the charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black robes draw across mosaic tiles as   "PHANTOM SNIPER slips down a hallway. A Dragunov Sniper   Rifle over shoulder, he hears the loop-hole charge   detonate nearby and turns, entering a tiled washroom to   his left. This is "MUSTAFA".

dialogues.speaker: LOOTED ROOM / CHRIS
dialogues.text: CHRIS lays his kit in front of the blast-hole: gun, flag, Bible. Packs a dip, elbows meet cement, eye meets glass--

dialogues.speaker: WASHROOM / MUSTAFA
dialogues.text: MUSTAFA lays in front of a mortar-hole. In a leather satchel: ammo, oil, cell phones. His eye meets glass--

dialogues.speaker: LOOTED ROOM
dialogues.text: CHRIS finds his stillness. The instant he does-- SHADOWS CREEP over him and night swallows the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A palm tree burns like a candle over Fallujah. Below it, head-lamps dance chaotic as VIPER TEAM MARINES exit a house spray-painting "X" on the gate. (03.18.14)                         33. MARINE VIPER #1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --hot as Bigfoot's ballsack over here. (knocks on next gate)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Derka, derka, derka.... MARINE VIPERS laugh, bowling into a courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glowing green hue. CROSS-HAIRS track the Marines entry, sweep the street and push toward the rooftop, when-- A SHOT SOUNDS. A MARINE FALLS in a 2nd story window. MARINE VIPER #4 (OS) (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Fuck! Man down! It came through the window-- CROSS-HAIRS whip across rooftops, on a swivel. CHRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was sniper fire. Shooter is on our side of Elizabeth street. Over. MARINE VIPER CO (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. East side of Elizabeth is locked-down. Over. Viper Marines drag the soldier out. In the phosphorous green glow, we watch his body tremor as he dies. SFX: CHRIS' ELEVATED HEARTBEAT pounds over scene as--

dialogues.speaker: WASHROOM
dialogues.text: MUSTAFA flees down the hall. A fluttering shadow in darkness, except for the reflective swoosh on his Nikes.

dialogues.speaker: LOOTED ROOM
dialogues.text: Chris lays on the gun, brow pinched with onus, silence like a scream. This happened on my watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS TRACK across the city-scape. TIME LAPSES and the world (in scope) SPEEDS UP. Humvees and tanks streak past, lights blur, trees blow in choppy havoc, then-- TIME SLOWS to a crawl as CROSS-HAIRS FIND A MALE hurrying into a alley, pulling shit from a pack. We zero-in and-- a flame flickers. The male is smoking opium. (03.18.14)                          34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS drift off him and TIME SPEEDS UP, dogs eat a rotting body by the roadside, vicious in fast motion. TWO WOMEN wobble down the road with buckets, wind whips roadside grass into a tizzy and WE HALT ON-- CROSS-HAIRS ON A PERFECT CIRCLE in the grass, a rifle- barrel? Stay on it. In stillness it finds context; a RUSTY PIPE. TIME SPEEDS FORWARD, TWO BOYS zip by on a Vespa, OLD MEN frantically bow to mecca on rooftops. Clouds boil across dawn sky. His eye never leaves glass. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like piss in here. (no response) You covered our ass out there, man. Appreciate it. Those were ballsy shots. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they were clean. Right? MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah, they were. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally looks up) That sniper walked right up our ass. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I chewed out our security detail. It won't happen again. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My shooter statements are on the dresser. Marc Lee picks up a stack of YELLOW PAPERS on the desk. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should be eight. Two got dragged off. (off Marc) Something wrong? MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... but you got more kills than the rest of the snipers combined. Chris rubs red "shooter's strawberries" from his elbows. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They still got one of our guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't shoot what you can't see. Marc's eyes land on piss-stained cement where Chris lay; this fucker didn't take his eye off the glass all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind miles of wire, a twenty-acre BASE CAMP. Aluminum trailers, shithouses and tent farms. A Humvee pulls past-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris steps in, letting the air-conditioning blow down on him. Cots, lockers and cruise-boxes line the room. Biggles reads a PUNISHER graphic novel, doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard you got your dick wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is everybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just picking our dicks here, training those fucking haji soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why ain't you out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the shits. Marc Lee said you were on fuckin fire out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shedding gear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still read comic books?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fuckin graphic novel. Talk to me, man. Did you pop your cherry? A heaviness falls over Chris, then slowly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid didn't even have hair on his balls and his mom hands him a grenade-- sends him running off to kill Marines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sees his hurt)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw his balls? (03.18.14)                        36. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was evil, man. That was hate like I've never seen it before. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid could've taken out ten Marines-- CHRIS (wrestling with it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did your job. End of fuckin story. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just not how you imagine the first one going down. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the other ones? What about the other kills? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other ones-- were righteous. Like God was blowing on my bullets. He's joking but not. Biggles smiles, jealous.

dialogues.speaker: OVERWATCH
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS land on INSURGENT WITH RIFLE; INSURGENT PEEPING three times; INSURGENT BURYING IEDs. BAM-BAM-BAM. ANOTHER SNIPER (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --that you again Kyle? CROSS-HAIRS are moving, no answer follows.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE INTEL TRAILER
dialogues.text: Chris is covered in dust, sitting in a small chair facing two clean, well rested JAG OFFICERS. JAG OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our task here is to make sure every kill is a righteous kill and conforms to ROEs. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By every kill, do you mean just our kills or you're monitoring the bad guys too? (03.18.14)                       37. JAG OFFICER #2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your scores at sniper school were average at best, then you get here and you're just lighting the world on fire? Chris opens a PLASTIC WATER BOTTLE, sips it, waits-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, was that a question?

dialogues.speaker: OVERWATCH
dialogues.text: Chris takes over for a MARINE SNIPER in a window. MARINE SNIPER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen shit all day. Maybe the war is over and they forgot to tell us. Chris settles in, still going through his ritual when AN INSURGENT crosses the street with CAR BATTERY and AK-47. CHRIS (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a armed military-aged male moving tactically with a car battery. Maybe he needs a jump? COMMANDING OFFICER (OS) (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Bomb maker. Green-light. Exhale, pause, pull. A SHOT RINGS OUT. MARINE SNIPER (OS) (just offstage)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --are you fucking serious?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE INTEL TRAILER
dialogues.text: CHRIS scrunches that EMPTY WATER BOTTLE, gratingly, as JAG OFFICERS continue the interrogation: JAG OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife said he was carrying a Koran. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know what a Koran looks like but I can describe what he was carrying-- it was pressed metal, fired 7.62s and looked just like an AK-47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, BIGGLES, D and DAUBER enter. Eyes find them, heads nodding to Chris, that the guy? Word spreading. Biggles sees it, hops up on a chair--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen up ladies and genitals. The Legend here would like you to know that when it comes to sniping it's better to be lucky than good! Our boy here has a Texas horseshoe crammed so far up his ass that-- Chris flings a cafeteria tray at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In murky predawn light, CHRIS sits on a SATELLITE PHONE--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you killed anyone yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how the call-home goes, babe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be weird with me. Seriously. I want you to tell me everything. Chris covers the phone as distant gunfire chatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 57   INT. CHRIS & TAYA'S HOUSE, SAN DIEGO - SAME TAYA sits in front of a partially assembled baby-crib with a six month baby bump. She turns down the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are things we can't say over the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knocked me up and now I'm stuck here by myself assembling baby-cribs and you can't talk to me? That's the big plan? HIS CROSS-HAIRS track across a distant rooftop. Socks sway from a clothesline in a 5 knot breeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys almost done over there yet? (03.18.14)                        39. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop thinking about that pink silky thing you wore on our honeymoon... TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called a nightgown. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And three days is not a honeymoon. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a good three days. I miss you bad. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curls up in chair) You want me to talk dirty to you? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But I got my gun in one hand and the phone in the other-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you'll just have to decide what's more important. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're horny preggers. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fat and horny. It's kinda disgusting. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could be 300 pounds I'd still do you. She's touched, hormonal, starts crying. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -So romantic. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's my boy? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody said it's a boy-- CROSS-HAIRS TRACK INSURGENTS on the street; then linger on a parked car, measuring distance by height-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see the way you are with him. You're gonna be incredible. (03.18.14)                         40. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (harbors doubt) How do you know? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just know. I can see it. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're right. Her face falls as-- TV NEWS shows the graphic of "American Death Toll in Iraq." The number is 835. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Did your dad get hold of you? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't checked any email. CROSS-HAIRS follow insurgents as they slip out of view. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. You need to call him. Hang up and-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so selfish. I wasn't even thinking-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your little brother deployed. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to jump school? I thought-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't get in. Just call your dad-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deployed where? Where's he going? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over there. He's headed to Iraq. The news ricochets around inside him like razor blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE MEN IN BALACLAVAS stand over an AMERICAN HOSTAGE in an orange jumpsuit. The thick Jihadist leader draws a machete to behead his hostage. VIDEO PAUSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man with the blade is a Jordanian radical funded by Bin Laden, trained by Bin Laden and loyal to Bin Laden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COLONEL GRONSKI is an old-school bulldozer. 75 Marines study an OLD PHOTO OF AL-ZARQAWI, bushy black eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is "Zarqawi" and he is the prince of al-Qaeda in Iraq. AQI, his mercenary army, are 5000 strong. They're trained well, paid well and waging the heaviest urban combat since Vietnam. FIND CHRIS in back, scanning heads for his brother Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zarqawi and his Lieutenants are our highest priority. Only way to root them out is to go house-to-house until we find them, or someone who will reveal their whereabouts. We need to clear ten structures an hour. It's aggressive so we'll loosen things up with air support-- Chris looks to Marc Lee, ten structures an hour?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun hangs like a blood-clot in the sky. Chris and Marc Lee are walking, TALKING LOW--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These Marines rush in like they been doing, they'll get their asses shot off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're Marines. They don't get the training we do. Half of them were civilians six months ago. Chris reacts, hearing him describing Jeff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So let's coach them up. I'll show them how Team Guys do it and lead a unit in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't do. We need you on overwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if I was down in the street--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: House-to-house is the deadliest job here. You got some kind of savior complex? Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna get the bad guys. And I can't shoot them if I can't see `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a hot hand. These Marines all know your name now and they think they're invincible with you up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are if they believe they are. Just keep banging on the long-gun and let these ground-pounders sniff out Zarqawi. Marc walks off leaving Chris biting at a shamal wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN F-18 RIPS OVERHEAD firing 500lb JDAMs into the next block. Smoke and dust billow outward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under a fluttering canopy, CHRIS lays on the gun, cursing zero visibility. GOAT camps nearby, on a GameBoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that AQI sniper was in the Olympics-- but Iraq hasn't qualified a shooter in the last three games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mustafa's not Iraqi. He's from Syria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris steals a glance at him, processing this as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILO COMPANY MARINES JOG to a pink house with windows boarded up. One of the Marines looks like Jeff Kyle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once you make entry I can't see shit, so keep it slow and push through the target. "Jeff Marine" sets a charge, turns-- not Jeff. The door blows off. Marines rush in. GUNFIRE POPS. Marines rush back out, dragging a WOUNDED MARINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this-- I'm going down to clear houses with the Marines. You coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No man. No. I like my life. I wanna make it home. I go fishing and do all kind of cool shit. It's not my job to knock down doors. Those guys picked the wrong fucking job. I ain't doing that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I don't see you down there, you make sure I don't see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILO COMPANY firing on the structure. "CPT. GILLESPIE" (smart, sunburned) is shouting "hold your fire" as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bowls up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna be a sniper? Swap me guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll roll with you guys if that's cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, any Navy Seal is cool by me. "THOMPSON" (big, wobbly voice) nods, lugging an M240G.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're that guy. They're calling you The Legend. You got like 24 confirmed kills. He recognizes his way to gain entry, so he plays it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 32. But who's counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's badass. "SANCHEZ" (neck tattoos, Catholic) chimes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some boy in Bravo catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (packs a dip)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'all are meateaters for sure but I got a little training I could show you, some simple shit, that might just keep us above ground. What do you say? His need to protect cloaked beneath cool cowboy calm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KILO COMPANY are doing house-to-house. On the job training. Tension high, they're bunched around a doorway. CHRIS motions them back, not so close, sets a charge--

dialogues.speaker: INT. HOUSE, DAY
dialogues.text: BOOM!-- KILO COMPANY ENTER a house with chandeliers and regal armoires. They clear the room, CHRIS teaching them how to move together, giving hand signals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Whas that mean again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover and follow. He follows Chris into a room with sofas, exotic rugs and- (03.18.14)                      45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KID(12) stands across the room with dark eyes and pronounced forehead, staring at Chris. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down. Down! On the floor, now! THE KID is rocking on his heels like he's going to run. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will fucking shoot you! Down! Get down-- FATHER OF KID (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please-- THE FATHER runs in, tall and bearded. Gillespie clocks him and he drops. The Kid screams like he's deaf. FATHER OF KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the floor) Please! He can't understand. Look at him-- GILLESPIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does look a little retarded. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were ordered to evacuate. Why are you still here? FATHER OF KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is our home. I won't give it to them. Or to you. SANCHEZ pushes THREE WOMEN (in berkas) into the room. SANCHEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I found these bitches in the back closet. FATHER OF KID

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sheikh al-Obeidi. You are my guest but please tell the others to come inside. If they are in the street he will know we have spoken. SANCHEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sand nig' want us in here so he can blow us up. Check his ass for a vest. A KETTLE whistles in the kitchen. Guns still trained. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who will know we've spoken? (03.18.14)                          46. SHEIK AL-OBEIDI/FATHER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your enemy is mine enemy. We share this. You understand? Chris studies the women, and lowers his gun. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the other guys in.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: Chris and Gillespie sit with "SHEIK AL-OBEIDI" while the kid ("OMAR") plays with his father's hair. SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we talk to US soldiers he will come to our home and make examples of us-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he? I need a name. The Marine Interpreter aka "TERP" (20s, in mismatched camo, face bandanna) repeats the question. SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man who comes we call The Butcher. He is the despaired one, son of Shaytan-- Sheik mumbles in Arabic, fearing the words on his tongue. TERP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls him - the pure flame of fire- . Basically, this man comes to their house and prey on the weak with hurt. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So he's some kind of enforcer? SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enforcer. Yes. Top soldier of Zarqawi. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jumps) We want Zarqawi. Where do we find Zarqawi? OMAR CACKLES like a crow, playing peeking games. SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you find The Butcher you will see he reports direct to Zarqawi each day. An F-18 rips overhead. RADIO CHATTER. THOMPSON steps out- (03.18.14)                          47. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we find him? SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must understand the risk to us. TERP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will ask for money. SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need one hundred thousand US dollars. THE BOOM of distant ordinance shakes the structure. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't even have proof this guy exists. The Sheik grabs his wife, pulls her arm from her robe-- her hand has been hacked off, the stump healing. SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this not proof? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I want to help you. I do. But I need names, places, phone numbers-- THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushes in) Hey, we got a Marine unit pinned down in a house just uprange-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me a name, Sheik. Give me something. THOMPSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're out of ammo. If we don't go now-- Sheik stonewalling, Chris stands to go, fuck-- SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Amir Khalaf Fanus". This is given name of The Butcher. But to help you find him-- Sheikh Obeidi SWEEPS A HAND across his open palm, pay me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris sweeps a hand across his open palm, pay me. We are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and MARC LEE sit in front of AGENT SHEAD, of the Defense Intelligence Agency. A game of solitaire open on his computer. CORNHUSKER football posters on his wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that translates to "pay me" in just about any language, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're the secret squirrel with the cash, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were having tea with Sheik al- Obedie did he tell you he ran a network of highway bandits before AQI moved in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He left that part out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's AQI's racket now. Your Sheik got edged out. This could be blowback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or he could be upset The Butcher cut off his wife's hand. Either way, seems like you'd wanna explore it. Shead would rather not enter into this with them but-- he slides a white-board to reveal an AQI HIERARCHY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your guy here. (points to photo directly under Zarqawi)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We believe The Butcher is Zarqawi's number two man. THE BUTCHER is a squat, rawboned man with eyebrows forming a grizzled line over dark bloodshot eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't know his real name or you'd have it written up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have several aliases-- (picks up phone, dialing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If "Fanus" is legit we go see the Sheik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's asking for 100,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he delivers the Butcher he'll get it. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Agent Shead, DIA, I need a name check on "Amir Khalaf Fanus." I'll wait. He kicks his feet up, like he runs the war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're going back out, TEAM 3 could pull security--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we're humping money the head-shed will want contractors on it. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here. What do you got? He listens a beat. His feet hit the floor. Eyes flick up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An object thumps beneath the tires. SECURITY CONTRACTORS wear baseball caps, Oakley blades and grizzled beards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Road-kill. They sit on benches opposite CHRIS and MARC LEE, a shrink wrapped PALLET OF CASH between them. AGENT SHEAD sits closest the driver, playing big-dick with the mercs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butcher is Zarqawi's enforcer. They say his weapon of choice is a drill. Chris looks to Marc Lee, eyes closed in prayer. When he opens them he sees Chris looking. The rig sways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I went to seminary school before I joined the Navy. Came close to being a preacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love to gamble, man. Love those dice. Their laughter is liberating. It bonds them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My kind of preacher. MORE LAUGHTER. A PHONE RINGS. Chris digs out a SAT PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like that now, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't heard? I'm The Legend. (laughs at self; into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey babe--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, doctor says it's a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a boy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yeah. Congratu-- WHAAP! Windshield spiders. CONTRACTOR/DRIVER'S brains spackle them. THE HUMVEE CRASHES into a storefront. RADIATOR HISSING, CONTRACTORS SCREAMING, "Call for backup" "Capel is down" "Dump the truck, cover us."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crowded quad. TAYA, ON THE PHONE, stops in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris!--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looted shops, burnt awnings, colorful signage. MARC LEE and CHRIS pile out. THE SAT PHONE falls in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard one shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check. Large caliber. Came in at an angle, gotta be 300 or more out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They duck into a bomb-blasted storefront. They're looking downrange from the jagged orifice when-- A SHOT THUNKS into a painted Leo DiCaprio billboard overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ducks back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all over us. You get a bead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transfer the pallet. We're pulling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSTAFA sprawled on the balcony. PUSH past the swoosh of Nikes, up dark robes, along the cut of an unshaven cheek-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UNIQUE CROSS-HAIRS wobble past CHRIS and MARC LEE'S position to CONTRACTORS SCRAMBLING SHEAD into the street. Mirage boils straight up. A breath exhales--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET SMOKES through CONTRACTOR #1, ejecting half his vertebrae. CONTRACTORS SCRAMBLING--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minaret, 11 o'clock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from Humvee)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no room. We'll come back for you-- Agent Shead and Contractors pull away in Humvee #2. An INSURGENT GUNNER steps from a door just uprange, BLASTING ROUNDS at the retreating vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got eyes on that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Their cover prevents line-of-sight. Chris reaches his rifle out ADJUSTING A SIDE-MIRROR on the crashed Humvee--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BUTCHER drags OMAR from Sheikh Al-Obeidi's home by his hair. The boy's strange screams echo down the block as the Butcher revs a hand drill near his face-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes on The Butcher. He's got that Sheikh's kid in the street-- TWO INSURGENTS holds Sheik Al-Obeidi in the doorway as-- A SNIPER ROUND SHATTERS the Humvee mirror. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!-- MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into radio) --requesting back-up. We're pinned down taking sniper fire on approach of high- value target, GRID 04536236. Over. Chris tries to edge around the wall-- PHWAAAP! The wall explodes above his head. He turns to the room. Debris blocks a back-door. No way out. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the wrong end of this. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna pop smoke for cover but don't move till I say. Chris tosses smoke. A haze clouds the exit-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold. The drill revs. Omar is screaming. Smoke spewing. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding! Hold... A SHOT RINGS OUT, CHUNKS CONCRETE near the exit. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move now. Go-- They slip out the storefront, around the building-- MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know he'd wait--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause I'd wait. In the smoky haze, A SAT PHONE in the dirt--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAYA listens for gunfire as the lunch crowd teems past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing, into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris-- CAMERA CIRCLES HER as her world comes unhinged. On the next revolution the scenery changes and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS TRACK past the doorway where--

dialogues.speaker: SHEIKH AL-OBEIDI
dialogues.text: Is held back by INSURGENT GUNMEN, weeping and pleading--

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTCHER
dialogues.text: He powers up the drill and drives it into Omar's thigh. OMAR SCREAMS and pitches, shrieking for help--

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Chris and Marc racing down an alley, approaching stairs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go around. I'll go high. Chris bounds up the stairs. Marc Lee keeps running--

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: CHRIS runs onto the exposed rooftop, running into-- A DOG SNAPS at him, BARKING and rabid, chained to a US sig M- 60. He dives away from it, crouching behind the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS FIND the barking dog, then CHRIS' BOOT.
