dialogues.speaker: THE BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Powers up the drill, THE BUZZING rings over his words--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) You talk to them, you die with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps on Omar's neck, lowers the drill toward his jaw.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Hears the drill and Omar's screams. He'll be exposed but- HE POPS UP to shoot The Butcher. Before he can get set-- A SNIPER ROUND clips his helmet. He's knocked flat-back. Clouds strobe overhead. The dog barks viciously inches from his face. Saliva flying off incisors as--

dialogues.speaker: THE SHEIKH
dialogues.text: Watches the drill enter his son's face. The Sheikh breaks free of the Butcher's men, running towards his son. TWO AKs shred his back and he pitches forward, reaching--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Butcher and his men drive away, CROSS-HAIRS track across the rooftop, where--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His helmet, ruptured like a plum, wobbles to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Rage animates him. He staggers to his feet, FIRING HIS M4 on the minaret until the clip expires. Then-- A FLUTTER of cloth sweeps across an alley a block north. MUSTAFA slows, rounding the corner, and glances back-- Chris draws his .45, but Mustafa slips into the shadows. Women sob over dead bodies in the street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM THREE SEALs hold perimeter. The sheet draped over Omar is marked by a dozen blood spots. Chris is buzzing with remorse, looking to the minaret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had line-of-sight 500 meters out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Colonel Gronski is all over Marc, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, COLONEL GRONSKI barks at MARC LEE then climbs in a Bradley. As MARC approaches--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to work up a squad to pursue him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shutting us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're confined to base pending an incident review.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can he do that? Just shelf us like that? I ship home in three weeks. Wind blows the sheet off Omar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be a long three weeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris stalks the cage, shirtless and sweating. His eyes track the horizon as darkness falls on Fallujah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halogen spotlights illuminate tarmac. SOLDIERS emerge from darkness, pushing toward their waiting families. FIND TAYA in heels, 9 months pregnant. Chris limps toward her. She walks into his arms and STARTS SWINGING fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were dead. I thought-- He holds her close until her rage gives way to tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh. I'm know. I'm so sorry. They stand there long after everyone has gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya lowers the lights, steps out of her dress and looks at herself in the mirror, 9 months pregnant, and not sure she's sexy. Chris exits the shower, stops, staring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the most beautiful thing I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an alien growing inside me-- She deflates and sits on the bed. He kneels before her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there's a strange man in my bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls his ring off necklace)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why isn't it on your finger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it catches the light... He doesn't spell it out. She slips it on his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hands feel different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're mine. I swear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I so fucking nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing her belly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm nervous too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not. Don't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am... What if that little alien reaches out and grabs me? She laughs and squishes his cheeks, making faces with his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so good with me. Her face opens in ecstasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS, showered, shaven and ill-at-ease, picking at the calloused "shooter's strawberries" on his elbows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it might be nice to get out-- His coffee steams like smoke off a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --are you listening to me? Chris--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knee pumping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?-- A lawn-mower starts. His eyes track windows. Taya sees what's happening and-- she extends a naked leg into his sight line. His eyes follow her leg, to welcoming eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want to do today, hon'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we just relax here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we do that. Let's relax. She eases into his lap, changing his chemistry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room doused in sunshine. TAYA lays on the table. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER works the ultra-sound wand over her belly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you feeling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done being pregnant. I want to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be any day now. (03.18.14)                       58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pets his wife's hair but he's sweaty and flushed. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you Mr. Kyle? How're you feeling? CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Doing good. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine you're still decompressing. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is the first time we left the house. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just happy to be home. Hoffstader studies him, reaches for a b.p. cuff. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, slip this on for me. He awkwardly consents. The cuff tightens. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you wanna help, you should be looking at my knees. I don't know what I did but-- DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a smoker? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ma'am. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you drink? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charming) Only when I'm thirsty. DOCTOR HOFFSTADER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 170 over 110. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Jesus Christ Chris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that high?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if you just had 14 cups of coffee. But for someone who is sitting down--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll look into it. Thanks doc. He's smiling but his tone quiets her. She overstepped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS is weaving through rush-hour traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sabotaged me back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do. You're not talking. You act like it's all okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is okay. I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not fine. Your blood pressure--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Babe, I'm driving down the freeway, it's sunny and 72 degrees. I'm fine. But there are people dying over there and I look around and it's like it's not even happening. It's barely on the news, no one talks about it. No one cares. And if I stay too long I'll forget about it too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at war and I'm headed to the mall. She looks pained, ready to cry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't belong here. I can't help anybody- She's arching in the seat, MOANING as her water breaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it's happening--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit-- Chris swerves from the SOUTHBOUND FAST-LANE across the dirt median and into the NORTHBOUND FAST-LANE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going back. Dust kicks up. Horns blare. He's speeding north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing and crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --oh my god, you're crazy! You're fucking crazy you know that? A look between them like spilled sunlight. He reaches and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya grips his hand. Her WAILING SCREAMS fall silent and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya stares blankly at Chris. He thinks he lost her. Then-- A SMALL CRY breaks the tension. Taya gasps. THE BOY lands in Chris' arms covered in vernix and blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My little man... He holds him to the light and relief pours over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at our boy. Look what we did. (nuzzles close to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, baby. We made it-- He holds his family close as BEDOUIN MUSIC SWELLS--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A THERMAL IMAGE. Cross-hairs on MARINES emerging from tall grass. A SHOT FIRED. A MARINE FALLS. An Arabic sickle & sword appears over the image. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS an Iraqi parcel on the coffee table. FIND CHRIS staring at the TV, livid, lit by Christmas lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The baby is crying. I thought you were-- Chris lunges for the remote as another KILL SHOT PLAYS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother turning it off, I already watched it. He looks up at her, holding Colton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to make sure you didn't have an Iraqi girlfriend sending sexy videos. He lightens, touching her, eyes drifting back to the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sniper is recording his kills. Mustafa. They sell these in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That day we were on the phone-- Chris nods, it was him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not protecting me by not talking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you thinking about it. I don't need you worrying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My imagination is so much worse than anything you could tell me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not. They're savages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fuckin savages. His blood pressure pulses on his unyielding face..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about them, it's about us. (hands him baby)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to make it back to us. Her eyes trail off him as she steps into the kitchen. Chris holds his son, taken with his ruddy innocence. Then the BEDOUIN MUSIC swells, his arms tighten around his son, and his eyes are drawn back to Mustafa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tail of a C-17 draws down. YOUNG MARINES file off leaving CHRIS, squinting into a dirty sunset as he tucks his ring away like he's stowing part of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp-nosed, fit)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, Petty Officer Kyle. Colonel Jones is waiting. How was the flight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slower than Christmas. Chris is following him toward a Blackhawk when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a second--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The colonel is waiting-- Chris is already striding across the tarmac toward--

dialogues.speaker: A SQUAD OF MARINES
dialogues.text: Loading onto a C-17 weary, injured, heading home. JEFF KYLE doesn't see Chris until he has hands on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, grunt-- Chris shakes him and pulls him into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris? Jeff is slow to react, like he can't see past the atrocity branded on back of his eyeballs. (03.18.14)                       63. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Y'alright? You in one piece? He looks him over, undamaged but for the eyes. MARINE LCPL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, PFC Kyle. Move your ass. Marines on-board the C-17. Jeff is anxious, shifting-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? Jeff?-- JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you're kickin ass our here. All the guys, that's what they say-- Chris fixes Jeff's collar: a tender gesture. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my hero, bro. Always have been. MASTER CHIEF MARTIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lets go, Kyle. Colonel's waiting-- JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (swollen with emotion) The Legend... The four massive turbo-engines on the C-17 kick-on. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over deafening noise) I'm gonna miss my ride. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just tired, man. I'm-- (swallows it) I'm going home. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you. You hear me? He can't hear shit over those fans. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad too. He's proud of you. JEFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this place--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't hear him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck this place. Chris ignites with rage at what they did to his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LT. COLONEL JONES is a clear-eyed Ivy grad: the new- school leadership changing of the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made Chief. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gronski's gone. A lot of top-brass are. We're working off a new playbook now. The Blackhawk lifts off, ZOOMING across the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've studied insurgencies for the last decade. I know every stone thrown since before the first century. These wars are won and lost in the minds of our enemy. He hands over an AQI BOUNTY POSTER with an illustration of a SNIPER RIFLE and GALLIC CROSS and a reward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you? Chris rolls his sleeve, showing his Gallic Cross tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're now the most wanted man in Iraq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's $80,000 on your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell my wife, she might take that number right about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand you wanted to put together a direct-action squad to hunt The Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We plugged the rat-hole that is Fallujah and flushed them into Ramadi. We got some intel indicating his area of operations. As they cross the Euphrates the SLUMS OF RAMADI are laid out before them like a blanket of chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to put the fear of God in these savages, and find his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS stands in front of Team Three, armed with a 60-inch monitor and a TuffBook. They're chanting, "Power-point."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys know how I hate this shit so shut your traps. Our target is Amir Khalaf Fanus aka The Butcher. (clicks first slide)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be heading in under cover of darkness, sector P13, north of the river-- They're cracking up. He turns to see his slide has been hijacked with A PHOTO OF HIS BACHELOR PARTY; the "best men" pose with a spray-painted groom. They look so young. Chris turns back to his men and, for a moment, their smiling faces appear immortal in the feeble light.

dialogues.speaker: TIME FADE
dialogues.text: Brief finished, TEAM THREE file out past Chris--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give good power-point, Legend. --grabbing ass and cracking jokes until one remains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this thing bulletproof? (holds Chris' Bible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never open it so I assumed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, country, family, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a God?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You getting weird on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had this electric fence around our property in Oregon and us kids used to see who could grab it and hang on the longest. War feels like that, it puts lightning in your bones, makes it hard to hold on to anything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to sit this one out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanna believe in what we're doing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evil lives here, we've seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It lives everywhere--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to invite these motherfuckers to come fight in San Diego? Or New York? We're protecting more than this dirt. Marc adopts his zeal, letting it fill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooyah then. Lets go kill this fucker. He bangs out. Chris is alone. Lightning in his bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neon shimmers across wet empty streets. TEAM THREE trundle past shops largely unbombed. TONY checks his GPS-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper-mic, pointing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This building, any apartment on the east side, will look down Fahima Halal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEAM THREE push to a door. Biggles has a cat-claw, ready to breach-- A BABY CRIES behind the door. Chris waves them off. Another door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper-mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breacher-up. BIGGLES is ready to wedge the cat-claw when he sees keys hanging from the door. He grins and simply opens it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A modest apartment. TEAM THREE have seated the family; A PROTECTIVE FATHER hugs his BOY(6) as his WIFE frets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell em they won't be leaving till we do-- (hands Terp a photo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask if they seen him. TERP TRANSLATES, showing a PHOTO OF THE BUTCHER.

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING OUT WINDOW
dialogues.text: The RESTAURANT BELOW is boarded up with painted metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hall & Oates song)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Private eyes, we're watching you, watching your every move...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why a restaurant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big freezers. Marc turns away, leaving them to wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep eyes on it get pictures of anyone coming and going. Biggles watches Chris collapse onto his ruck-sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Chief Nappy-nap. A challenging smile. Chris flips him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got some nice rugs up in here. (thumbs up to Father)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit is hand-knotted. Beautiful. Surveillance rolling, Chris closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TIME CUT
dialogues.text: In darkness, CHRIS bolts upright then sees his guys by the window. He joins them. Despite rolling blackouts, light is visible around plywood on Fahima Halal windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 16 military aged males have gone in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They serve more customers than McDonalds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And check this. ON DIGI-CAMERA, ZOOMS ON PHOTO of The Butcher entering--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He still inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only clocking one point of entry. He's in there, but it's no easy breach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they see it's The Legend they'll probably just invite him in-- (03.18.14)                        69. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a problem? I didn't promote myself. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I did it for you. You'd never have made Chief if I nicknamed you "The Myth". Chris snaps Biggles down, wrestles him into a choke. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Myth becomes Legend when we occupy a house, get 23 kills, and 21 are his. TONY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. It's everybody's Navy. Chris releases him. Biggles is coughing. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --naw, it's Legend's Navy now. Just hope he leaves some for the rest of us. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hash out tactics. We go at zero-dark. And Big Giggles is making the coffee. Biggles is flipping him off when the FATHER SPEAKS: TERP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translates) He invites you to join him for Eid al- Adha supper. He says -on this day everyone has a seat at my table-. Chris nods dubious gratitude, meeting the Father's eyes. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him that's very generous of him.

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM
dialogues.text: A braised head of lamb eaten clean. TEAM 3 are chowing down, in good spirits, as Chris watches THE FATHER teach his SON to read. He is moved by their connection and acutely aware of what this war is costing him. That's when he sees-- (ECU) "SHOOTERS STRAWBERRIES" on father's elbows. They're red and calloused, like his own. Chris darkens, stands and slips down the hall--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS searches the closet, ripping through clothes, pressing wall panels. He's crossing to the bed when-- FLOORBOARDS CREAK beneath the rug underfoot. He stands there, shifting his weight, floor creaking.

dialogues.speaker: DINING ROOM/HALLWAY
dialogues.text: BIGGLES is shoveling food in his mouth when a hand stops him. Chris signals, no more. FATHER'S eyes flick up as-- CHRIS RIPS THE FATHER out of his chair, dragging him down the hall by his hair. WIFE and KIDS screaming. "D" holds them off as-- Chris dumps the father at a STASH HOLE in the floor. Inside, a CACHE OF AKs, RPGs, IED components.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him he's gonna be shipped off for detention and the Iraqi courts can decide what to do with him-- or he can help us get inside that restaurant down there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a bad move--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's our breech. He's a fucking way in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If something happens--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's AQI man, look what he's holding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his choice. Tell him. The Terp translates. Father reacts, pale with defiance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE FATHER shuffles up the dusty street toward us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching the door...

dialogues.speaker: IN ADJACENT ALLEY
dialogues.text: CHRIS, MARC LEE and "D" waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10 meters...

dialogues.speaker: BACK ALLEY
dialogues.text: TONY and BIGGLES watching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5 meters...

dialogues.speaker: SNIPERS NEST
dialogues.text: DAUBER watches with cross-hairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's knocking...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: A sliding grate opens and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're vetting him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER attempts to alert the Guard, nodding to the TWO MEN in robes at the oil drum. Guard doesn't see it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold. Hold--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door opens, the GUARD comes into view--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris fires and the GUARD'S HEAD explodes. FATHER dives for Guard's weapon, FIRING BACK at Chris when-- GUNFIRE FROM INSIDE shreds him. He folds forward, dead. TWO MEN in robes (TONY & BIGGLES) rush the door tossi grenades, pulling the father out as the GRENADES EXPLODE. CHRIS, MARC LEE and "D" push inside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A smoky banquet hall. GUNFIRE lights from far wall. A man we recognize as THE BUTCHER is ushered through a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have eyes on the target. Flushing them out the back--

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: TONY and BIGGLES are posted in the alley, waiting. BIGGLES (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: BANQUET HALL
dialogues.text: CHRIS and COMPANY push through the doorway the Butcher passed through, but it's not an exit. It is--

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: An IRAQI MAN is hung up by a chain, the majority of his skin carved off, still alive. A walk-in freezer ahead. CHRIS (to "D")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help him-- MARC LEE (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here. Stairs lead down into darkness. Chris follows him into--

dialogues.speaker: AN UNDERGROUND TUNNEL
dialogues.text: A naked bulb illuminates a tunnel stretching to darkness. CHRIS (realizes; keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming back up! Watch your six-- THE TUNNEL DETONATES. Dirt and debris explode at them.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ALLEY
dialogues.text: BIGGLES and TONY are posted up. The RADIO STATIC-- BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I can't hear you. Say again.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THEM
dialogues.text: TEN INSURGENTS pour out of another building, circling back toward Biggles and Tony.

dialogues.speaker: KITCHEN
dialogues.text: CHRIS and MARC LEE bowl in, panicked, covered in dirt. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move. "D" turns from a WALK-IN FREEZER full of bloody parts. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big freezers. (sickened, following)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck--

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER NEST
dialogues.text: DAUBER SEES INSURGENTS approaching Biggles-- DAUBER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggles! Watch your six. Roadies on you-- He starts downing them but more seep out downrange.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ALLEY
dialogues.text: BIGGLES and TONY are banging away but outgunned when CHRIS, MARC LEE and "D" steps out, laying down fire. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back! Loading-- BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you. Biggles is slaying combatants. Precise and deadly. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: RPG
dialogues.text: AN RPG burns down the alley, screaming between them and EXPLODES INTO SNIPER NEST. As dust clouds the night--

dialogues.speaker: THE BUTCHER
dialogues.text: Slips through smoke, shooting his way to a getaway truck. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact. Eyes on The Butcher. 12 o'clock. MORE INSURGENTS, push up the alley, covering him. CHRIS (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dauber? You got visual? Confirm.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER NEST
dialogues.text: Dauber struggles from under debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative. No shot--

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Advancing along the wall. The Butcher jumps into a truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the move. Crossing! Biggles side-steps into the street, attracting fire, downing MULTIPLE INSURGENTS as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got you. Got you. Go, go, go-- Chris dodges behind him, running into the next street (parallel with truck) hoping for a shot--

dialogues.speaker: NEXT INTERSECTION
dialogues.text: As Chris arrives, the GETAWAY TRUCK roars past a block to the north. He continues at a dead-sprint but-- At next intersection, he's lost more ground. He halts, sucking wind, GALLIC CROSS TATTOO visible on his forearm.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE, (LOOKING OUT)
dialogues.text: A YOUNG SHADOW stands in the window, watching the soldier below. She picks up an old Nokia Cellular, dialing--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incense wafts over oiled components of a DRAGUNOV SNIPER RIFLE laid out on a prayer rug. A CELL BUZZES and is answered. A few words and-- HANDS ENTER FRAME, assembling the rifle. The metallic snap-and-slide escalating as we-- PAN TO the wall, the GALLIC CROSS depicted beside a sniper rifle on a faded CHRIS KYLE BOUNTY POSTER there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIRE FIRES spit tendrils of black smoke. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A four way intersection, neighbors pouring into streets. An angry crowd hoists the FATHER'S BODY in the air as a MESSIANIC TRIBAL LEADER riles them with chants. THE SON stands up-front, small hands fisted, glaring at CHRIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't take eyes off son)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I offered his father detention. I gave him a choice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picked the wrong fucking side. That's all there is to it. Fog of war. THE CROWD growing in tension and number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we have armed insurgents moving this way. We need to make tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hops in Bradley)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva an effort here, Chief. You keep after this bastard. We'll get him. As they roar off, Chris pulls Terp over to the TRIBAL LEADER whose SHOCKING GREEN EYES reflect firelight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him this boy's father was fighting for the people that butchered the clerics we found in the freezer in there.

dialogues.speaker: DISTANT ALLEY
dialogues.text: A flutter of robes. A rusty gate pushed open by an OLD MAN. Mustafa slips past, brushing the man's shoulder in thanks. Breath in cadence with step, his head turns up-- Smoke plumes into night, their signal leading him ahead.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS/TRIBAL LEADER
dialogues.text: Terp translates, Tribal Leader responds violently--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - This is our territory. If you want to come here, you ask me. If you want to find someone, I find them- (03.18.14)                          76. BIGGLES (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (atop Humvee, on the .60) Fuck `em. Let's go. Shit's getting hairy. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Tribal Leader) If I ask for your help you're the one they carve up next. I've seen it happen. A crowd of 300 chanting, as Terp translates.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: TWO MEN stand by a 12 foot wall. A dark shape sprints toward them. One man kneels, the other braces him. The reflective swoosh catches light as-- Mustafa runs up the man's back, leaping onto the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS/TRIBAL LEADER
dialogues.text: Tribal Leader rages, crowd at his back, eyes on fire-- TERP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -I am the seventh son of Isaac of Abraham. This is the land of my father, and I am not afraid.- He says your evil is greater than those you fight. He calls you white satan, devil of Ramadi. Venom peels across Chris' face and makes it appear true. A Nike swoosh reflects from a near rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Nikes cross gravel. Mustafa kneels. Unfolds his bi-pod.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS/TRIBAL LEADER
dialogues.text: CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell him to deliver The Butcher to us, or the devil comes back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS TRACK past smoke blown sideways, trash gusting-- FIND CHRIS as he turns for the Humvee. Cross- hairs leading him, compensating for windage. As he pauses his exhale-- THE FATHER'S BODY is hoisted in the air. Mustafa tries to adjust as his SHOT RINGS OUT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROUND HITS the shield. BIGGLES fires at the rooftop. Bullets strafing night as the Humvee door closes and they roar off. A PUNISHER SKULL drawn in grease on his shield, gleams in the moonlight. Mustafa's shot struck the Punisher in the eye. PUSH ON the teeth of the logo and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS' LONG FINGERS pressed to the glass. SFX: his breath rattles quietly over following scenes. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS stares into the nursery window where his NEWBORN DAUGHTER CRIES. The air thick and dreamlike around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The news is saying the war is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But are we winning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... TWO NURSES walk past his daughter. Chris bangs on the glass, trying to get their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, some help here-- She's crying-- He pounds the glass. The nurses don't hear him. SFX: THE MECHANISTIC BUZZ of power-tools overwhelms the scene--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS GUMBALL MACHINES and TOY DISPENSERS on the wall. The POWER TOOLS whining as COLTON(3) holds a toy, pissed it's not the one he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want that one-- (03.18.14)                         78. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the air still thick, his words spoken from afar)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get to choose, bubba. COLTON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't like it! I want that one-- THE DRILL BUZZES in the garage. Chris' nerves fraying. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get what it gives you. That's how this thing works. Colton melts to the floor crying. CUSTOMERS looking now. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this. Get up. Come on-- THROUGH VIEWING WINDOW-- THE MAN with the drill is visible. Dark hair like The Butcher, turning toward us-- RECEPTIONIST (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Kyle, your truck is ready. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps-to; to Colton) Get off the floor. Right now-- MAN'S VOICE (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. A YOUNG MAN steps too close. Chris rears up, defensive. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you... "Chief" Chris Kyle? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me. YOUNG MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to intrude, sir, but we met in Fallujah. You saved my life. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I--? YOUNG MAN/VETERAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. My name is Mads. We were trapped in a house when you showed up with 1st Marines. You carried me out. (03.18.14)                          79. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lifetimes ago, but) Yeah. Right. Well, you Marines saved our ass plenty out there. How you holding up? MADS/YOUNG VETERAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, sir. I'm grateful to be alive. It hasn't been easy but-- He lifts his pant-leg and shows an ARTIFICIAL LEG. MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It cost lots of guys more than a leg. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you lose some friends? MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too, but I'm talking about guys that lived. They made it back but they're just not back. They can't seem to get right. DRILL STARTS UP again. Chris glances that direction. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I-- I'm sorry to hear that. MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come down to the VA sometime. The guys would love it. They all know who The Legend is. Chris nods like he never will. Mads kneels to Colton. MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you missed your daddy when he was gone. But can I tell you something? Your dad is a hero. He saved my life-- (eyes well up) He helped me get home to my little girl. Colton looks up at his dad who swells with emotion. OTHER CUSTOMERS watching now, captivated. MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So thank you for loaning him to us, li'l man. I wouldn't be here without him. Mads stands and comes to attention, saluting Chris. MADS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My family thanks you for your service. Chris bites back emotion, nods, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pink cocoon of a room. Taya sits in a rocker, breast- feeding their daughter, MCKENNA. She's gentle, imploring-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm making memories by myself. I have no one to share them with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have the rest of our lives for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does that start? Even when you're here you're not here. Taya pulls McKenna off her breast. Chris scoops her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate the teams for it. I do. You're my husband and the father of my children-- but they're the ones that pull you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doesn't look up from his daughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can wait. They can't. A long pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think this war isn't changing you you're wrong. He looks up and POV CHRIS-- Taya sits in her rocker on the side of a ROAD IN RAMADI, destruction all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can only circle the flame so long. SCORE BUILDS, a steely guitar over tribal drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A TRUCK speeds past a burnt rocker in the street. We are-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUNISHER SKULL stenciled on flack jacket, CHRIS mans a suspended MK48 swinging where a passenger seat should be. A skull bandanna and sunglasses cover his grizzled face. The Punishers-- (03.18.14)                        81. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) --we are tailing the Butcher's courier, turning onto Maryland Street. Over. BIGGLES DRIVES, trailing a BROWN VAN. The city goes from light to shadow as they enter a built-up section called--

dialogues.speaker: THE CHINESE APARTMENTS
dialogues.text: BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought the ring. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here? BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're cheaper here. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want some savage's ring? What if it's a blood diamond? BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you care? You spilled more blood than anyone! CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a rock. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, man. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease off, don't get too close. (the van turns ahead) You gonna tell her where it came from? BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no! I'll tell her I got from Zales. They're laughing, off the leash, cocky and invincible.

dialogues.speaker: A BLOCK BACK
dialogues.text: MARC LEE drives. "D" rides shotgun. DAUBER in back. Uniforms bastardized; metal blasting in broad daylight. BIGGLES (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio) Still with us cookie? (03.18.14)                          82. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike, checking GPS) Half a block back and we are wet and ready, Big Giggles. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 years from now, we'll have a reunion and you'll be married to a dude. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as you cook and clean. DAUBER sits in back, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCOVER TRUCK
dialogues.text: STREET SPOTTERS reach for their cell phones. Chris glares at them, ominous in skull mask, flipping the bird. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butcher has his peepers out. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This motherfucker is Keyser SГ¶ze. Next time you got a shot try not to miss. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I coulda taken him in that alley if I didn't have to save your ass-- BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (accelerates) Whatever helps you sleep at night.

dialogues.speaker: ON A ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: A BAREFOOT TEENAGER races across gravel, aims a RIFLE down at the taxi with The Punisher symbol--

dialogues.speaker: UNDERCOVER TRUCK
dialogues.text: BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna be my best man? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still masked) Is it just me? Or other guys too? BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucking egomaniac-- A ROUND pierces the roof and goes through the floorboard-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooftop, twelve-o'clock-- SIX INSURGENTS pop up on a rooftop, firing. Chris leans into the .60 spitting lead in pneumatic bursts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dry hand spins   a SNIPER ROUND on a tabletop. It wobbl to a stop facing   the man who set it in motion-- MUSTAFA head-on. A messy   beard and thousand-yard stare. Haunted but unrelenting,   he spins the round again. An IRAQI WOMAN appears, shushing an infant. She says something to Mustafa but he doesn't respond. A phone vibrates. He grabs a duffel and steps out. By the door, A PHOTO OF MUSTAFA on a medal stand at the Olympic Games.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggles speeds after the van, taking fire from above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a shot, grandma. Biggles stomps the accelerator, whips around a corner--

dialogues.speaker: A SHORT STRAIGHTAWAY
dialogues.text: CHRIS BLASTS 200 ROUNDS (MK48) into the van; pulverizes the thing and watches it hiss to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should do it. COURIER bounds out of the van, diving into a building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck!? How'd he survive--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rubber junk-man's got your horseshoe. They roll out in pursuit. The Humvee pulls up. Inside--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --need a two block perimeter around the area. No one gets in or out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSTAFA crosses rooftop-to-rooftop with fluency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLOOD DROPLETS lead to a door. Biggles kicks-in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biggles and Chris dance around each other like smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear. An open window. Stairs climb the wall outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're headed to the roof. Secure the van.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN
dialogues.text: DAUBER and TONY cover MARC LEE and "D" as they open the back of the van. Inside, flats of RED CLAY TILES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Butcher is building a 7-11? Marc rips off the top layer, finds: 200,000 ROUNDS AMMO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No ammo, no jihad.

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Drying sheets billow on crisscrossing wires. Chris tracks blood-drops to the ledge. The next roof 15 feet off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell'd he make that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't-- Two stories below, COURIER lays face down in his mess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for leading us to the Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for him having my horseshoe. (03.18.14)                         85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris pulls his mask down. He has a beard and the sturm und drang of war are writ loud on his face.

dialogues.speaker: DISTANT BALUSTRADE
dialogues.text: MUSTAFA lays prone, mumbles a prayer and takes two deep breaths before putting his eye to the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS TACK to fluttering sheets, the wind revealed in their billow. TWO FIGURES are cloaked there, indistinguishable heads peaking over laundry lines. He aims left-and-above the head closest to him.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOF
dialogues.text: Chris and Biggles stand among the billowing sheets. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll take it to Zales and try to find out how much your spent. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not like that. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all like that. BIGGLES

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's giant, bro. Four karats. It had to belong to one of Saddam's bitches-- Chris is laughing when he sees a FLASH OF GLASS in the distance. Before he can utter a warning--

dialogues.speaker: A GUNSHOT SOUNDS
dialogues.text: The bullet flays the muzzle of Biggles M4. Shrapnel enters his face. Biggles goes down in a red mist-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!-- The right side of his face is a pulpy cavity. His eye socket obliterated. He appears mortally wounded. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dives on him, keys mike) Biggles is down. Man down. (pulls Biggles close, chiseled with grief)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, buddy. No! Stay with me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drags him one way, then another. He can't see past the blood-spackled sheets. A SHOT pocks the roof at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover! I need cover. He's picking us off. ANOTHER SHOT inches from his head. They are being hunted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gargled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm got it. I got it-- I can walk-- Biggles pulls himself up, tilting his head forward to not choke on his own blood. With heroic effort, he stumbles to the stairs. Chris, stunned he's alive, ducks an arm--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO MARINE UNITS provide cover as the Humvee speeds off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARC LEE drives. DAUBER applies gauze to hold Biggles face on. CHRIS kneels there, holding his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gargling blood)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm sorry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got nothing to be sorry for. I shouldn't have had us up there--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I gonna die? Chris looks to Dauber--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll rub a little dirt in it, get you a sip of water, you'll be fine. Dauber shakes his head, he's not going to make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --it was always gonna be me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coulda been any of us. Just hang on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. Not the Legend. You lucky fuck-- His body goes into shock. Chris comes unwound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't die, Ryan. You hold on--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOW ANGLE- plywood floor littered with needles, blood and latex gloves. A cart is rushed past. MEDICAL PERSONNEL shouting, "we're losing him." The picture pulses, blurs--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PUNISHERS stand around the Humvee, still as a photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see where it came from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was 1000 meters out. Only one enemy sniper makes that shot. A jeep pulls up. COLONEL JONES and MASTER CHIEF MARTIN step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will he make it? Chris turns away, choked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look good, Master Chief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the first SEAL hit, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! The sun high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Shi'a cab driver we source is saying there's a stronghold seven doors down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marine units that covered your exfil are still engaged there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can understand if you want to stand- down and regroup. It's up to you. The wind blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lex talionis... (looks up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eye for eye, tooth for tooth. They all agree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: METALLICA, "Master of Puppets" blasts as an M1A2 ABRAMS TANK speeds 45 mph down a street, bad as fuck. TWO BRADLEY TRANSPORT vehicles follow. A CAR pulls into the road ahead. INSURGENT PASSENGER leans out, FIRING AN RPG. It explodes across the tank but does no damage. Tank still coming, Insurgents pull away-- But the tank catches them. Treads climbing the back of the car, overtaking it. INSURGENTS are trying to get out, screaming, as steel folds around them and flattens them. And the ABRAMS vaults off the other side--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PUNISHERS. Ears pinned back. Metal blasting. Amp'd to kill. FIND CHRIS consumed by rage; he pulls the BIBLE and AMERICAN FLAG out and sets them aside. This is personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two clicks out. Lock and load. He glances at Chris, feeding off him. They all are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Biggles.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STREET
dialogues.text: The tank skids to a stop. The turret spins to a castle- like structure and BA-BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PUNISHERS pour out of their Bradleys, rolling in both directions, arcing toward the point of entry--

dialogues.speaker: THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: Punishers pour in. FOUR INSURGENTS lay dead, dispatched by the tank. Zero resistance. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Courtyard is clear. Moving. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some stronghold. Move. DAUBER and TONY follow them up a crumbled staircase--

dialogues.speaker: LONG HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Ominously still. Sunlight spills through grated windows facing the street. Chris and Marc move to the first door-

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOM
dialogues.text: A sleeping mat. A TV plays an Al Jazeeri game show. Marc pushes toward the bathroom, coming around the corner---

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The faucet runs on a straight-razor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear.

dialogues.speaker: FIRST ROOM
dialogues.text: MARC steps back in, golden dust motes float around him. MARC LEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody left in a hurry. CHRIS (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure we got the right address-- CANON-FIRE HITS the outer-hallway from across the street. Brrrrrb-Brrrrb!! Rounds banging with seismic force.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from hallway)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck-- TIME SLOWS as Chris bounds toward the door. Marc Lee gets there first, steps through it, into--

dialogues.speaker: LONG HALLWAY
dialogues.text: GUNFIRE RAINS through grated windows. The hall is coming apart in dusty chunks of plaster. DAUBER and TONY are pinned between windows. MARC LEE steps to the nearest window to lay suppressive fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contact--

dialogues.speaker: OPEN MOUTH. HE'S BLOWN BACKWARDS, HITTING THE WALL AND--
dialogues.text: MARC LEE is down. Blood pooling. A forever stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marc-- CHRIS is staggered but his training takes over and he steps into the same window, BLASTING FIRE. DAUBER is trying to intubate Marc but the back of his head is gone. He was dead before he hit the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trembling is the turbulence. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In dim red-glow, FIND BIGGLES in a tented gurney, stable but critical; his head caved in. CHRIS stares ahead--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Glory is something some men chase and others find themselves stumbling upon." REVERSE TO MARC LEE'S CASKET draped in stars and stripes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pasture of tombstones overlook the Pacific. CHRIS, with a chest-full of medals, stands with TAYA, COLTON(4) and MCKENNA(2). TAYA watches MARC'S WIFE weep as-- MARC LEE'S MOM reads his LAST LETTER HOME:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "My question is when does glory fade away and become a wrongful crusade?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "When does it become an unjustified means by which one is completely consumed." COLTON reaches for his father's hand. Chris jumps, startled. He looks at Colton, then Taya. He's caught with his guard down and it appears he may let them in... But he quickly returns his gaze to the flagged casket.

dialogues.speaker: CASKET
dialogues.text: NAVY SEALS bang their Tridents into the coffin. A hollow thump, like fists trying to revive a heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: San Diego traffic. THE KIDS chatter in back. CHRIS drives, in a fugue-state when he spots-- A BROWN VAN, four cars back, same as the one in Ramadi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marc wrote that letter two weeks ago. Did he say any of that to you? VAN ROARS up the turning lane. It's pulling alongside them. Chris grips the wheel, ready-- the van roars past

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris? I want to know what you thought of his letter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slow, absent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An AQI informant called in a tip. Biggles had just been shot. We were operating off emotion and-- we walked into an ambush. The kids grow quiet. The air sucked from the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not what killed him. That letter did. That letter killed Marc. (looks to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He let go and he paid the price for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taya turns away, wrecked. They drive in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TV lights the dark room. NEWS GRAPHIC: "Americans killed in Iraq: 3932". CHRIS and TAYA talk to the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If something ever happened to me-- you'd meet someone else. You'd be alright. His detachment is unearthly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to die? Is that what it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cheeks shine with tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell me why do you do it. I want to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do it for you. To protect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't. I'm here. Your family is here. Your children have no father--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without this, there's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit. It's not about us anymore. You don't know when to quit. It's over- (violent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did your part! We sacrificed enough. Let somebody else go--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could never live with myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find a way! You have to. I need you to be human again. I need you here. (no response, she calms)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave again, we might not be here when you get back. It startles him and he seems suddenly alert to her suffering. He reaches for her, holding her to his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Her eyes sink into a well of ruin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DUST MOTH flutters around the wall sconce. Wilted flowers and "get-well" cards cover the windowsill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enters)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buddy-- BIGGLES lays in bed. Part of his head caved-in and badly marred, one eyelid open on a milky-white eyeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris? Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right here just give me a minute-- (hobbles around the bed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just blind as a bat, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... It fucking blows. They're gonna fix my face though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. Your face always needed a little fixing. Chris sounds upbeat but his eyes betray him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you proposed? Did you tell Kelly the diamond was from Zales?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw, I bought a new one. A small one. Her dad helped me out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wouldn't leave me, bro. I told her to go-- but she wouldn't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice cracking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's getting a raw fucking deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No she's not. How can you say that? She's getting you. (eyes welling up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All four inches. Biggles laughs and tears roll from his vacant eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad this happened to me and not you. No way you could've handled it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably right. There is a pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They say you're the deadliest sniper in U.S. Military history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what they say? Biggles grows quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bad guys fled up into to Sadr City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna wall `em in and hunt `em down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I do. You're my brother and they're going to pay for what they did to you. His mind made up. Biggles moved by it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hooyah, Legend. Hooyah--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 75 Marines packed in. CHRIS hobbles up the isle like Achilles. His import draws the attention of soldiers he passes. He settles into a seat. Across from him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Legend, right? I heard you killed 101 men your last tour. The hajis call you The Devil of Ramadi. Chris removes his wedding band, hangs it from his necklace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how many kills you got now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to ask the Navy. I lost count. His reserve silences the Lieutenant. ENGINES ROAR as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This base feels like a remote outpost. CHRIS and "D" walk past a boneyard of charred vehicles. (03.18.14)                         96. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We been shot off position three nights in a row. Fallujah was bad, Ramadi was worse but this shit is fuckin biblical. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other Punishers here? "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squirrel cycled out. Dauber was coming back but his wife knocked him up. And if I bring home another rug my old lady'll murder my ass. Teams and shit. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nostalgic) Teams and shit. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) That Biggles news hit hard. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I visited him before I left. That fucker can't see shit. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops walking) Bro... Biggles is gone. He was in surgery yesterday and he died on the table. Chris stares at him, ruined, waiting for him to take it back. SFX: A PHONE RINGS thousands of miles away as--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS track along Jamila street, past cranes assembling the T-wall that will stretch across the city. The phone stops ringing, VOICEMAIL picks up. TAYA VOICEMAIL (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -This is Taya, I can't get to the phone so please leave a message. A car pulls into an intersection, ominous in inactivity. Dust blows sideways off its halted tires. CHRIS MESSAGE (VO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. I'm just calling to hear your voice. I'm missing you guys. I been thinking about some things you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car disappears down a side-street. CROSS-HAIRS linger at that spot, knowing the routine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the kids I love them. AN INSURGENT darts out, flips the sight-finder on an RPG. Mirage boils off the street, same as dust, 45 degrees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too. CROSS-HAIRS compensate left for windage. A SHOT RINGS OUT. Red mist. CROSS-HAIRS scan the sector, they won't leave an RPG. Finally, ANOTHER FIGURE runs out--

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG KID
dialogues.text: No older than Colton. He grabs the RPG, shoulders it. CROSS-HAIRS zero on him, center-mass. SFX: Chris' heartbeat bangs like a 800lb hammer. Not again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it-- CROSS-HAIRS tremor as Chris' hands start to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --please God-- Young Kid takes aims and-- suddenly discards the RPG in the street and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: He rolls off the gun, gasping for air, biting back tears. After nearly a decade of war he's finally breaking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind batters the tent. A squad of 16 SPEC OPS GUYS from different branches study a map with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brass believe this T-wall will end the war by trapping remaining AQI inside. But we got a sniper picking off contractors from deep behind the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep? Every man looks to the back wall where Chris stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roughly 1000 meters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it Mustafa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moo-who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sniper who shot our boy Biggles. That's a warning. Ranger One backs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can be whoever you need him to be, we just need him dead. Chris nods, eyes ablaze. Martin points to a map, south of the wall is green, north of wall is red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (points to red-zone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll shuttle you six blocks north into enemy territory which will put you right up under his nose when he takes his shot. Storm winds blast the tent flap open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of a fucking sandstorm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring your goggles, Bambi. We need to shut this shooter down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Stryker rumbles out, headed across the desert floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS sits up front, eyes drawn to an OLD MERCEDES speeding across the desert toward them. A train of dust plumes behind it. As the vehicles pass-- (ECU) TWO IRAQI MEN in the Mercedes hide their faces behind keffiyehs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that-- Chris whips around in his seat but can't look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARINE GATE-GUARD studies the approaching OLD MERCEDES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike) This is east gate. We've got an unknown vehicle coming up fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards roll out, guns up. Mercedes skids to a stop outside the serpentine barriers. Dust blooms from it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car! Now--

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE MERCEDES
dialogues.text: TWO IRAQI MEN eye the guards. THE DRIVER mutters something to the passenger and pops the trunk--

dialogues.speaker: GUARD POST
dialogues.text: GUARDS, lit with urgency, react as-- BOTH MEN STEP OUT of the Mercedes, hands in air, circling toward the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FIRES WARNING SHOT) --move for the trunk you will be shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TWO IRAQI MEN duck behind the trunk. After a painfully long moment, they reemerge with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it! Right there! Drop him now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drop A MAN BOUND in blood-smeared plastic. GUARDS BARKING orders. THE DRIVER unwinds his scarf to reveal-- MESSIANIC TRIBAL LEADER (shock green eyes) who confronted Chris in Ramadi; the one tasked with finding The Butcher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Tell the devil we found his Butcher. We will protect ourselves now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits for response. Guns stay on him. The wind howls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beaten to within an inch of his life. Bloody plastic suffocates his mouth as he tries to inhale.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: The Stryker speeds up a side-street into insurgent territory (north of wall). Next street over, PACKS OF INSURGENTS push south, toward the construction site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stryker slows. Boots hit dirt, silently slipping into--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH UPSIDE a five story building. Bombed-out walls reveal conveyors and fruit lockers inside.

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: An open rooftop, RANGER ONE is concealed under a vent as INSURGENTS pass in droves in the street below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streets are crawling. Hold your fire. Across the roof, "D" on a .50 BMG looking at the MILE- WIDE SANDSTORM pushing toward Baghdad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter the fuckin sandman.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: 3rd floor. In a fruit locker. Breath racing. Hands tremoring. Electricity coursing through him. Gun pointed north, Chris searches nearby buildings for the sniper. PUSH BEHIND HIM, SIX-BLOCKS SOUTH to--

dialogues.speaker: T-WALL
dialogues.text: A CRANE lowers a T-block. ARMY ENGINEERS guide it in.

dialogues.speaker: ENEMY CROSS-HAIRS ENTER FRAME, (REVERSE ANGLE)
dialogues.text: ARMY ENGINEERS in the street signal success and ANOTHER ENGINEER scurries up the neck of the crane to release the chain. The cross-hairs track the MOVING ENGINEER and-- (03.18.14)                         101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! A shot echoes across the landscape and TOPPLES THE ENGINEER from the crane. He lands dead in the street.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Hears it, pulls off the gun, looking behind him. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No-- (keys mike) It came from behind us. We went the wrong way. He's south of the wall. RANGER ONE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over mike) Doesn't matter. Hold your fire. We got uglies right below us-- Chris repositions himself, FACING SOUTH-- he lowers his eye to glass, bleeding sweat, aiming toward Baghdad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS track to distant rooftops. Everything wobbles and fumes. Trash blows, fronds sway, curtains flap, mirage boils-- all gusting different directions. Almost by accident, he lands on an IMPOSSIBLY SMALL SHAPE. Person? A bag of trash? Or nothing at all. As small as a pepper-flake inside the radius of his scope. CHRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) I got something. 1900 yards out. RANGER ONE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't even see that far out. Hold your fire. You'll expose us all. He twitches and wobbles off-target by a city block. "D" (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, Legend. No bueno. CROSS-HAIRS tracking back, measuring between mil- reticals, calculating for distance. Back on target: CHRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correction. 2100 yards out. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a mile. Impossible shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.

dialogues.speaker: ENEMY SNIPER HIDE
dialogues.text: THE SNIPER is covered in a black Hefty bag disguising his presentation, and identity. Ready to kill again. CHRIS (OS) (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Charlie 7 Bravo. We have eyes on the target. Initiate QRF. Over. "D" (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you confirm it's him.

dialogues.speaker: ON CHRIS
dialogues.text: Trying to breathe it down, please god, breathe it down-- CHRIS (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has eyes on our guys. RANGER ONE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick Reaction Force is 20 minutes out. You will stand the fuck down-- Chris scoops dust off the floor and watches with his off- eye, as it blows off his palm and plumes outward. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your call, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS track to the cluster of MARINE ENGINEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CROSS-HAIRS wobble on the dark shape a mile away. "D" (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got it, take it. RANGER ONE (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, negative-- CHRIS (OC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim small. Aim small. We zero-in on a small fold on that black bag. SFX: A LOW FREQUENCY BUZZ escalates as concentration deepens. (03.18.14)                       103.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER
dialogues.text: Face obscured, a PRAYER HISSES from his bearded mouth.

dialogues.speaker: CHRIS
dialogues.text: Both eyes open, a PRAYER WHISPERS across his lips. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Biggles.

dialogues.speaker: SNIPER/CLOSE ON CHRIS
dialogues.text: SFX: Thump-thump....Thump-BAM! Chris fires first. The shot echoes across eternity. One, two, three seconds later. A red-mist paints the wind. THE SNIPER tumbles off his platform and out of view. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tango down. The world rushing back in, he hears INSURGENTS below.

dialogues.speaker: STREET BELOW FACTORY
dialogues.text: INSURGENTS point up at the building, yelling, rushing in-

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Chris bangs onto the roof, shaken, joining a 6 MAN SQUAD. RANGER ONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just fucked us, Legend-- (screams into mike) We need Stryker and QRF units, ASAP. CHRIS KYLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was on our boys and I took him out. RANGER ONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are fucked like a football bat. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished. Biggles be proud. A look between them, fully aware of what comes next.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE VIEW, (FACTORY)
dialogues.text: INSURGENTS clear the second floor, bounding toward--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS and Squad set-up firing stations. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two ways onto the roof. We cover both stairways and conserve ammo. Muted nods all around. Footsteps coming. This is it. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you FNGs shit your pants, don't stop shooting. Scoop and shoot. Scoop and-- GUNFIRE POPS behind them. MARINE GUNNER lights it up. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Conserve-- OPPOSITE DOOR bangs open across the roof. Chris hammers the INSURGENT but he keeps coming, drugged up. TWO MORE roll out behind him, on the same glue. This is close-quarter contact, visceral and savage.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STREET
dialogues.text: INSURGENTS enter surrounding buildings in droves.

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: Wind kicking up. Ammo running out. Insurgents keep coming. Worst environment imaginable. RANGER ONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mike) Negative, negative, danger-close, they're all over us-- "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop motherfucker! Drop! CHRIS laces bad guys. Pure brutality. They fall at his feet. Tracers light from the next roof. "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3 o'clock. Loading. Last mag. RANGER ONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) QRF is stuck three blocks out. MARINE GUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out of ammo--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSURGENTS use rebar to cross from a nearby rooftop. Two ways just became three. They're swarming them. Hand-to-hand chaos. A bad way to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna get dragged in the street--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it in. Light us up. Chris wields his .45, spackled with blood--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. Call in our coordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys mike)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rio Two Bravo, requesting ordinance drop. GRID 04837959. (gunfire)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know my fucking position! They're right on top of us. Drop it! RADIO GOES STATIC, he nods, it's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White-side! INSURGENTS crossing the gap. Chris pivots--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DRONE FOOTAGE of Chris on the roof of the Banana Factory. Surrounding streets are filled with bad guys. We are--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wind battling tent. MASTER CHIEF MARTIN stands over a NAVY DISPATCH OPERATOR, staring at the footage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell the pilot to turn it loose. DISPATCH OPERATOR looks up, realizing what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILOT looks to his wing as STINGER MISSILES engage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3-4, copy that. 30 seconds out. (03.18.14)                        106.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: TWO DOZEN insurgents surround them on the rooftop. CHRIS waits till a guy gets right up on him and-- BAM! "D"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're up-- "D" trades the SATELLITE PHONE for Chris' Springfield. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --you got four rounds. In their exchange, an unspoken goodbye. Then-- Chris struggles to dial, hands shaking. IT RINGS. He squints north. RINGS AGAIN. F-18 rocketing toward him-- TAYA (OS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Chris is stunned. She answered. He's speechless. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (struggles) Hey baby-- TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris-- What's the noise? Wind howls. F-18 closing. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear you-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready to come home. I'm ready... She starts crying. The F-18 almost upon them. TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening-- CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm coming home. Can you hear me? TAYA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris-- F-18 seconds out. Chris looks up and sees-- (03.18.14)                         107.

dialogues.speaker: THE SANDSTORM
dialogues.text: Has shifted. A tsunami of dirt is about to swallow them.

dialogues.speaker: F-18 RAPTOR
dialogues.text: THE PILOT flying into the storm. Sensors screaming. He can't hold his line. 4, 3, 2-- He pulls up early.

dialogues.speaker: ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: HELLFIRE MISSILES scream over the Banana factory and EXPLODE INTO the next building. Fire and dirt engulf them. The blast recedes but the sand-storm escalates. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, go, let's move-- He leads "D", RANGER ONE and FOUR OTHERS across the roof. They stumble past INSURGENTS, blinded by sand.

dialogues.speaker: STREET BELOW
dialogues.text: CHRIS and SQUAD stagger into HOWLING CHAOS, clinging to each other, trailing Chris as GUNFIRE POPS behind them. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (choking, into mike) Stryker-3, what's your location-- AN INSURGENT is blown right into them. "D" wrestles his gun away and beats him with it. CHRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold there! We are 30 seconds out-- (pointing ahead) Go. Straight ahead. Go-- They run for their lives. Unable to see two feet ahead. Sand shredding their skin. Chris is struggling-- Squad passing him. Knees failing him. He can't keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE GUNNER stares at REMOTE WEAPONS SCREEN when SIX FIGURES EMERGE from the dust. He's about to fire-- GUNNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BDUs-- That's them! Drop the ramp. The ramp drops. STORM HOWLING. RANGER-ONE dives in, MARINES follow, then "D" rolls in. The rig pulls off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Chris? He was just--
